profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-07-25 12:25:32 -0400.

repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Library

did.abstract: Labor union of workers in the printing and publishing trades in the Hartford, Connecticut, region. Collection consists of a meeting minute book, 1896-1905, and a seal press of the Ladies Auxiliary No. 72, undated but indicating after 1926.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open and available for research.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was donated by the Connecticut State Library Archives on February 9, 1984.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The Allied Printing Trades Council was a labor union with a group whose members worked in the printing and publishing trades in the Hartford, Connecticut, region.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item description, #:#] Allied Printing Trades Council Records. Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains the 1896-1905 meeting minutes of the Allied Printing Trades Council from Hartford, Connecticut, and a seal press for the Women's Auxiliary No. 72 to the Typographical Union No. 127.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from these Papers must be obtained in writing from the owner(s) of the copyright.

did.unittitle: Seal press; reads "Women's Auxiliary No. 72 to Typographical Union No. 127, Organized at Hartford, Conn., Dec. 30, 1926"
